description: NVRAM operation functions (nvram_get, nvram_set, nvram_unset, etc.) were found in /usr/sbin/nvram. This program provides a command-line interface to manage NVRAM variables, including getting, setting, deleting variables, and committing changes. Security risks: 1) No obvious input validation vulnerabilities were found; 2) The program has basic parameter checks; 3) The use of strncpy limits buffer size, reducing overflow risks.

The getenv function import was found in /sbin/httpd, but no direct calls were detected. This indicates the web service may interact with the system through environment variables rather than directly accessing NVRAM. Security risks: 1) No direct unsafe operations were identified; 2) Further analysis is required to determine how environment variables are being utilized.

Multiple system binaries were found to import NVRAM-related functions, including /sbin/smbd, /usr/sbin/acsd, etc., indicating these services may interact with NVRAM. Security risk: Each binary needs to be analyzed individually to determine specific NVRAM access patterns and potential risks.
